text: Thanks <@UFBDBKQ1H> I suppose it’s my Oauth authentification because the token isn’t persisted. Have you a tuto for rails ? I use Devise and maybe Doorkeeper

Hi Everyone.
I wanted to know if there is a way to get the deals from the last 60 days using the Deals API. I only managed to get the last 30 days. But maybe the Beta API has the solution.

Is there a way to upload a private file to the CRM via API and associate it to a Deal or Contact? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/files/post_files>
Does hiding the file still leave the file as public on the CDN ?

Hey, <@UFRLX48M6>. Yeah, it doesn’t seem possible to create a property in the UI with `__` in the internal name.

The [Object] Properties APIs (e.g. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/v2/create_contacts_property>) allow it, though.

Hey, <@UQXJS578F>. This currently isn’t possible with the publicly available Deals API endpoints. You must either get deals from the last 30 days (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/get_deals_modified>) or get all deals (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/get-all-deals>) and filter on your end.

As you alluded to, though, the CRM API in closed beta at this moment makes this possible.
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1574799478272800?thread_ts=1574777427.270600&cid=C2YHAHB6K>

Hey, <@UPUNJBVK5>. Yes, you can upload hidden files via that endpoint by including `&hidden=true`. Per the documentation:

> Hidden files can be included as attachments to engagements [on any CRM object].
No, if a file is hidden, it will _not_ be accessible via a public CDN URL.
Awesome thanks! Wasn’t 100% on that part.

:thumbsup: you probably know this already, but once you upload the file, you can associate with a deal, contact, or any other CRM object via the CRM Associations API (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/crm-associations-overview>).
Hello <@UDDJG2VFG>. So with the CRM API it is possible to get all deals from the last 60 days, right?
Yes, because it includes searching and filtering capabilities which the current CRM APIs (Contacts, Companies, etc.) do not.
Thanks again

Hi, <@UBRG1R3EW>. This is not currently possible. You can infer what subscription types an account has by what scopes are granted (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/initiate-oauth-integration#scopes>), but there’s no way to confirm with more granular details.

If neither the Forms API nor Tracking Code API (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/identify_visitor>) work, then you could associate the `utk` value with a contact through the Timeline API: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/timeline/timeline-overview>.
i see. I suppose i can do that using the CRM Objects API
And the object properties
FYI, I’ve had an open ticket for a month or so because even if you upload a file in the CRM itself (non-API), they can intermittently end up in the marketing CDN
Thanks for the heads up - will test this out

Also, what Isaac is saying directly contradicts what I was told in this Slack by another HubSpot employee about 2 months ago, and the API documentation still says to not upload sensitive files to the file manager :man-shrugging:
Yea was a little confused by the giant red text saying it goes on the CDN regardless
Have you tested this by chance?
Honestly, when we saw customer contracts start showing up in the marketing file manager/CDN because of that bug, we’ve tried to stop using HubSpot’s file manager at all
I might give it a whirl via POSTMAN this afternoon and see what happens

Even if it works in Postman, I still wouldn’t put anything sensitive up… or keep a very close eye on the marketing file manager. Because the process you’ll be testing out is the same buggy one used by the CRM front-end.
Appears to work - All CDN urls are returning Forbidden 403 when tried to access directly.
Hopefully the issue has been resolved - will keep an eye on it anyway during bulk upload
As of 5 days ago, support said they’re working on it but couldn’t give a concrete timeline for the fix

Hello All - As far as I can tell you can't run a report based on the date that a contact property changes form one value to another ( i.e. give me all the customers that changed their favorite color from red to blue this week ) . Is there a way to access a particular contact property change history thru the API? My hope is to populate a custom field when a certain change happens so I can run the reports I need based on that new field.
Were you having this issue via CRM interface or via API… or both ?
